comment._content: www.hotels.com/ho242965/le-manoir-hotel-pas-de-calais-dep... Le Manoir Hotel, Etaples, near Le Touquet, Pas-de-Calais, France "ANGLO-NORMAN COUNTRY HOUSE BUILT IN 1911- WAS THE FAMILY RESIDENCE OF THE GOLF CLUB FOUNDER- ALLEN STONEHAM. NOWADAYS- CONVERTED TO A 3 STAR HOTEL" The hotel has two 18-hole golf courses and one of 9 holes, but doesn't seem to offer riding as an activity. From www.simonseeks.com/travel-guides/le-chic-le-touquet__111048 "But the fact remains that Le Touquet Paris Plage was created by two enterprising Englishmen, John Whitely and Allen Stoneham. They bought Le Foret (a dowdy stretch of land) in 1903 from a failed vegetable-grower turned pine-tree-planter and built expensive hotels and villas and sold them to the rich and famous of London."
